title: Oprah Winfrey Makes $70 Million in One Day From Weight Watchers Investment
text:
Comments Oprah's big name has caused the stock of the company to increase drastically and she reportedly makes $70 million in just a day from her investment. 
The stock of Wight Watchers increased significantly after Oprah Winfrey announced on Monday, October 19 that she invested in the company. The 61-year-old media proprietor reportedly made $70 million for her investment. Oprah tweeted on Monday, "I believe in the @weightwatchers program so much I decided to invest, join the Board, and partner in #wwfamily evolution." She took a 10% stake which equaled to 6.4 million shares. As to why Oprah wanted to invest and joined the Board in the company, she said in a statement, "Weight Watchers has given me the tools to begin to make the lasting shift that I and so many of us who are struggling with weight have longed for. I believe in the program so much I decided to invest in the company and partner in its evolution." Oprah's big name was reportedly the main cause why the stock increased drastically. According to S&P Capital IQ analyst Efraim Levy, the former host of " The Oprah Winfrey Show " "will not just bring attention to the stock, but will accelerate sales and profit recoveries" as the company benefits from "free publicity and media savvy." While Oprah's single-day earning may be a large sum for most people, it was just "a drop in the bucket" for her, according to USA Today. As Forbes reported, Oprah is worth an estimated $3.1 billion.
